Also Billie Lourd manages to steal every scene she's in. Seána Kerslake is decent in the main role and the main child actor is uneven at times but, both manage to be somewhat convincing in the roles.   While the film's tired premise and uneven performances bring it down a bit, it's elevated by some exceptional directing, great soundtrack and somewhat effective scares.

reviews.the-exorcist: 9/10 The first 20 minutes kind of drag on a bit but after that the almost slow burn feel of the film really helps add to the atmosphere. Also William Friedkin's directing is haunting and some of the shots are incredibly striking.
reviews.sinister: 5/10 There are some aspects here that work for example, there's some decent scares every now and then, the atmosphere is occasionally effective, the soundtrack's surprisingly good and the two main performances were great but, overall it feels really dull and squanders what is actually a pretty creepy concept.
reviews.juno: 8/10 JK Simmons as a dad > every dad in fiction
reviews.rockos-modern-life-static-cling: 8/10 Considering I don't have any previous personal attachment to the original show, I never thought I'd be saying that a Rocko's Modern Life reboot is one of my favourite films of the year so far.   This > most reboots from the past 20 years.
reviews.frankensteins-monsters-monster-frankenst: 6/10 This was kind of funny and entertaining in its own way but, I still don't know what it actually is.
reviews.dont-look-away: 1/10    So did the dad decide that an evil monster stalking their family wasn't something he should have given a heads up on?
reviews.a-simple-favor: 7/10    This was basically a trashy and messy version of Gone Girl but I'm okay with that I think?
reviews.the-invitation-2015: 7/10    Cults and dinner parties make a dangerous combination.
reviews.eugene-2012: 6/10    My favourite part about this was that the guy could bring basically anything into real life and the first thing he chooses is a singular pea.
reviews.enter-the-anime: 2/10 The editing in this should be considered a crime.
reviews.the-favourite: 10/10 Basically perfect. Yorgos can do no wrong.
reviews.the-machinist: 7/10 Some of the plot feels like it treads familiar ground but, Christian Bale's performance is astonishing and it feels like a Hitcock movie mixed with a Fincher movie on drugs so yeah it was pretty good.
reviews.cannibal-holocaust: 2/10 While it does deserve some merit mainly with the direction and soundtrack, it trades a good script and meaningful or interesting characters for cheap shock value which makes it an utterly repulsive yet strangely boring viewing experience.
reviews.kitbull: 8/10 Pixar stop making me cry challenge.
reviews.i-am-easy-to-find: 9/10 Didn't know it was possible for a film to make me feel every emotion in less than 30 minutes.
reviews.weekend-2011: 9/10 At the gay awards:Call Me By Your Name I'm really happy for you and imma let you finish. But Weekend is one of the best romance films OF ALL TIME!
reviews.the-descent: 8/10 I would say this ruined cave exploring for me but, I rarely leave my house so that doesn't affect me too much.
reviews.cop-car: 6/10 Kevin Bacon's mustache in this could start its own cinematic universe.
reviews.dont-look-now: 8/10 Didn't like it as much as I thought I would and the last 20 minutes are easily the best part of it but, the chilling and almost ethereal atmosphere along with the performances make it a very interesting watch especially due to a lot of the stylistic choices.
reviews.attack-the-block: 8/10 John Boyega if you read this im free on friday night and would like to hang out. please respond to this and then hang out with me on friday night when I'm free.
reviews.under-the-silver-lake: 8/10    Considering the somewhat mixed reaction I'd seen to this i was pleasantly surprised. It's a film that I can imagine being stronger on repeat viewings. Unfortunately it feels a bit too long at parts and some of the writing feels a bit messy with some of the story aspects not being fully explored.   The directing is definitely one of the best things about it and feels very reminiscent of mystery/noir films from the golden age of Hollywood. The mystery of...
reviews.short-term-12-2013: 10/10 Talked to a doctor and they told me to stop watching films that make me cry for 96 minutes straight.   All the performances are great, especially Brie Larson as always and it feels so overwhelmingly kind hearted and charming at times while also balancing some heartbreaking moments.
reviews.snowpiercer: 9/10    Wow Chris Evans really destroyed an aristocracy huh.
reviews.spotlight: 9/10 An eye opening and chilling look at the manipulation of people's faith and the importance of journalism.
reviews.creed-ii: 8/10 While it's not as good as its predecessor and occasionally relies on clichés, the emotional conflict is really engaging and all the performances are once again incredibly believable. I also liked how the villains weren't one dimensional and actually had character and a motivation instead of just being evil Russians.
reviews.rejected: 8/10 I wish I could draw/animate so I could make insane stuff like this.
reviews.murder-party: 6/10 While it doesn't reach its unhinged potential until the last 30 minutes, there's some good jokes and the concept feels fresh and engaging enough to at least be entertaining. Also who puts raisins in bread?
reviews.tetsuo-the-iron-man: 7/10 Robert Downey Jr could never. Now don't get me wrong I liked this but, someone needs to go to jail for this. It's pure insanity. Looking at it as a horror film it works pretty well. It's unsettling and it never really makes any sense which adds to the offputting tone.   Honestly this was just Eraserhead but for anime fans and that's ok.
reviews.eyes-without-a-face: 8/10 A chilling and strangely poetic film. The directing really complimented the dark tone and the slow buildup was well executed.
reviews.room-237: 5/10 If The Shining leaves the viewer in a trance, Room 237 leaves the viewer bored and kind of confused. While some of the people have some decent points, a majority of them make no sense.   The film exhibits some interesting ideas and a potentially great concept and turns it into something that's underwhelming and seemingly pointless. For me, it hadn't changed anything about The Shining and the way I perceive it which I assume is the purpose. Overall it left me kind of disappointed but not really hating it due to some of the decent ideas presented.
reviews.mysterious-skin: 8/10 I find it quite difficult to review this. It's incredibly disturbing and uncomfortable at parts and there's some weird choices with the editing every now and then. But, on the whole it's pretty effective.   Apart from some of the child acting, all of the acting feels almost raw especially Joseph Gordon Levitt. The directing feels almost personal and really helps add to the tone and performances.   Watching this made me realise how much I miss Joseph Gordon Levitt being in films.
reviews.pride-2014: 9/10 I love being gay. This is now a Pride and Imelda Staunton stan account.
reviews.deliverance: 7/10    Unfortunately the film is at its best during the opening hour and after that it kind of loses steam. Still it's highly unsettling and most of the performances are pretty good. It's also very good for anyone looking for a film where two people try to out-banjo each other.
reviews.room-2015: 10/10 My heart needs a break rn.
reviews.repulsion: 8/10 The only bad thing about this was that it was directed by Roman Polanski.
reviews.first-man: 10/10 Damien Chazelle make a bad film challenge.
reviews.the-dead-dont-die-2019: 6/10    Tilda Swinton being an alien and getting beamed up wasn't in the script, she can just do that.
reviews.hellboy-2019: 1/10 I hate only watching half of a film and then giving my opinion, mainly because it seems unfair but I think this should be an exception because this film is so painfully bad that I couldn't bare to sit through another hour.
reviews.a-close-shave-1995: 10/10 Wallace stopped talking to someone because they didn't like cheese.   *Icon*
reviews.the-wrong-trousers: 10/10 How can a stop motion penguin made of clay evoke such raw menace.   But yeah this is still one of the best pieces of animation of all time. The charming plot, humour and stunning stop motion animation make it a true classic.
reviews.yesterday-2019: 3/10 "Just do it" - a guy in the cinema during a scene between the two main characters.
reviews.godzilla-king-of-the-monsters-2019: 2/10 A lot of the potentially stunning visuals was obscured by a constant use of rain and abundant use of grey and brown. None of the characters have any development and it's hard to care for any of them when most of their dialogue is exposition. Also the occasional bits of humour were very bad and felt really out of place.
reviews.brightburn: 5/10 While the film uses its admittedly silly premise for some entertaining horror sequences, the first act is too dull and the script feels lazy.
reviews.toy-story-4: 9/10 As someone who thought this was completely pointless I was surprised by how good this ended up being. The humour and the more emotional aspects were very well balanced and the animation was stunning at times.
reviews.toy-story-3: 10/10 Probably my favourite out of the first 3. Emotional, funny and incredibly heartfelt.
reviews.toy-story-2: 10/10 I think I liked this a bit more. The story is a lot more emotional and has a lot of weight behind it, the animation is significantly better and the humour is almost perfect. I still think the first one is the best but, this definitely improves upon it.
reviews.toy-story: 10/10 Apart from some of the animation looking a bit dated this is still a classic that manages to hold up 24 years later.
reviews.dark-phoenix: 2/10 A mess that while hilarious at times due to its sheer incompetence was boring, had a terrible script and had a story that felt scattered and rushed.
reviews.black-mirror-rachel-jack-and-ashley-too: 2/10 This feels like someone trying to make their own Black Mirror episode but failing to understand what makes Black Mirror good. It's not as clever or interesting as it has been before and the humour is painfully unfunny and incredibly misplaced.
reviews.burning-2018: 8/10 Apart from pacing issues during the start of the film this is a deeply unsettling character study with some breathtaking directing and genuinely impressive performances.
reviews.the-lego-movie-2-the-second-part: 8/10 While not as good as the original, it's still a charming, endearing and incredibly well written sequel.
reviews.pet-sematary-2019: 3/10 It's a shame this is as bad as it is because it had a lot of potential. Unfortunately the pacing is awful, none of the characters are interesting, the directing is lifeless (no pun intended) and the only thing scary about this film are some of the performances. Apart from occasional glimpses of some scary imagery and some pretty decent body horror special effects it's a huge let down. Honestly I'd rather watch the other pet sematary film from 1989 because at least that was entertaining, this is just incredibly dull.
reviews.batman-1989: 10/10 30th anniversary re-release:  I think watching this in a cinema helped me appreciate it a lot more. Especially with Tim Burton's great directing and Danny Elfman's iconic score standing out a lot more. Jack Nicholson and Michael Keaton both give stand out performances, with Jack Nicholson having so much screen presence and putting everything into the role.
reviews.john-wick-chapter-2: 9/10 John Wick 2 does everything a good sequel should. It doubles down on the brutal and incredible action and expands on the unique world.
reviews.bohemian-rhapsody: 1/10 Wasted potential. Rami Malek won an oscar for lip syncing and wearing a hilariously bad fake set of teeth. The editing is shockingly bad, the cinematography is decent at best and considering this is a biopic, it's weird how little this shows about Freddie Mercury's life instead choosing to use a cookie cutter story. The concert sequences in the film are decent but you could watch the real concerts on YouTube for free and get the same experience.   Hopefully Rocketman will do the exact opposite and actually be good.
reviews.the-host: 9/10 A highly effective monster film with a surprisingly emotional core.
reviews.turbo: 1/10 Dreamworks have probably turned down many great scripts yet greenlit a film about racing snails.
reviews.keith-lemon-the-film: 1/10 This is without a doubt the worst film I have ever seen.
reviews.the-harry-hill-movie: 1/10 Every now and then I'll remember this exists and wasn't some bizarre fever dream.
